topics.body:
Oh oh; I had a thought as to why the world has so many problems; it's pretty simple really.

To use a metaphor there was once a carpenter who made a castle for a king.  The king did not create the castle, nor did he understand any of the construction; all he did was put forth to create a castle and have those fund it.  The carpenter stored his tools within the walls of the castle so that he could at least leave some proof of his existence after he died; after the carpenter died the king found the tools and removed it from the castle.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
